byline.contributor: James C. McKinley Jr. and William K. Rashbaum contributed reporting.
byline.original: By WILLIAM NEUMAN and J. DAVID GOODMAN

abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio, during news conference in Bay Ridge, Brooklyn, denies that he broke any campaign finance laws and hints that investigations into his political fund-raising are motivated by politics; statements echo letter sent by Laurence D Laufer, lawyer for his re-election campaign, to State Board of Elections.

headline.print_headline: Mayor, Denying Misdeeds Again, Says Accusations May Be Driven by Politics
headline.main: De Blasio, Denying Misdeeds Again, Says Claims May Be Driven by Politics

snippet: Queried about a series of investigations, Mayor Bill de Blasio stuck to his defense that no laws were broken and that politics may be behind the inquiries.
lead_paragraph: Queried about a series of investigations, Mayor Bill de Blasio stuck to his defense that no laws were broken and that politics may be behind the inquiries.
